Improve the sound quality of your device, for use with hearing aids.
Special call is needed to activate your device service. After pressing Activate, follow instructions to activate your device.

If you skip activation, you cannot make calls or connect to mobile data networks (though you can connect to Wi-Fi networks). Until you activate your device, you will be asked to activate it each time you turn it on.
Follow the spoken instructions until you hear that activation is completed
Device is being programmed. Please wait.
Phone activated. It may take up to 15 minutes for service to start.
Device activation failed. You may need to find an area with better signal (near windows or outside). Try again or call customer service for more options.

When you make emergency calls, Auto reject mode will be turned off automatically so you can receive calls from the emergency call acceptance organization.

When you make emergency calls, Blocking mode will be turned off automatically so you can receive calls from the emergency call acceptance organization.

Press the power key to end calls when screen is on. This will not turn off screen.
Unable to set the power key to end calls while the proximity sensor is off. The proximity sensor will be turned on. During calls, the screen will be turned off when you bring your device to your ear.
Unable to turn off proximity sensor while the power key is set to end calls. The power key will no longer end calls.
Say “Answer” or “Reject” to answer or reject calls with your voice.
Say “%1$s” or “%2$s” to answer or reject calls with your voice.
Unable to use voice commands while sound mode is set to Vibrate.
To improve the recognition of the voice commands when answering or rejecting calls, try saying them during the gaps in your ringtone, when there is less background noise.

Your recording has been saved in Voice Recorder.
Unable to record. Media scanner is running.
Disconnect storage from computer before recording voice calls.
Dialing to the T roaming customer center
How to turn Roaming auto dial on or off

[Roaming auto dial] is available while you are roaming. This feature simplifies the dialing process by automatically inserting international call code and Korean country code (82) before a number you entered manually or selected from the phonebook or call log.

"You can make calls just as you would in Korea. Enter a number manually or select a number from the phonebook or call log and then select Call Korea. Example: To call 010-1234-5678 from Beijing to Korea, enter 010-1234-5678 (or select the number from phonebook or call log) and then select Call Korea."

"To call within a foreign country: Enter a number manually or select a number from the phonebook or call log and then select Call other countries. Example: To call a Beijing number while in Beijing, enter the number and then select Call other countries. To call another country while outside Korea: Enter the international call code, country code, and the number, and then select Call other countries. You can insert the international call code with a plus sign (press the 0 key) and must remove the first zero from the number. Example: To call 06-1234-5678 from Beijing, China to Osaka, Japan, enter +81-6-1234-5678, and then select Call other countries."
"If you have more questions, please contact the T roaming customer center. Enter 114 with the keypad and select Call Korea to contact the T roaming customer center (+82-2-6343-9000)."
How to turn Roaming auto dial on or off
"You can turn Roaming auto dial on or off. Select T roaming > Roaming auto dial and then select an option: On: turns on Roaming auto dial Off: turns off Roaming auto dial"
How to use the Current local time information service

[Current local time information service] is a free service that gives the local time in another country. To subscribe to this service, call T Roaming customer center. Enter 114 with the keypad and select Call Korea to call the T roaming customer center (+82-2-6343-9000).
Dialing to the MOFAT call center

"This service is supported by Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trades (MOFAT) and provides you with help in the following situations: Lost/Stolen - Contact information for local police station - Passport reissue / Travel certificate issue Injured/Dead - Local hospital information and translation Arrested/Imprisoned - Contact information for Korean embassies - Legal services / Translation Enter 112, 113, or 119 and then select Call Korea to contact the MOFAT call center (+82-2-3210-0404)"
You can set Roaming auto dial on roaming area.
You can inform Roaming auto dial on roaming area.

"Mobile data is turned on by default. This may result in additional charges from your service provider depending on your payment plan. To turn off Mobile data, go to %s."
Device configuration will be adapted according to your Internet tariff. Do you have a flat Internet tariff rate?

Mobile data is currently turned on. Connecting to mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan. To turn off Mobile data, go to Settings > Data usage, then select Mobile data. Multimedia messages can still be sent and received while Mobile data is turned off.
Roaming off. Tap here to turn it on.
Selecting data roaming may incur additional costs. Refer to your tariff plan.

Mobile data will be turned off."
While Mobile data is turned off, you will not be able to use Internet, Email, or other apps that require a network connection, unless you connect to a Wi-Fi network. Mobile data will be turned off.

Data roaming abroad may result in excessive charges depending on the policies of the local network provider.

"You are using a USIM card from a service provider other than LG U+. Your service has been restricted according to your data plan.
- If your service provider is SKT, turn on 3G network mode if you have a 3G data plan, or turn on 3G or LTE network mode if you have an LTE data plan.
You can only use data services if LTE network mode is turned on.
- If your service provider is KT, turn on 3G network mode regardless of your data plan. The LTE service is not supported by your service provider.
- If you turn on 3G network mode, you will only be able to use the phone, messaging, and data service functions.
To change your network mode, go to Settings > More networks > Mobile networks > Mobile network methods, then select 3G network mode or LTE network mode."
To turn on Mobile data, go to Settings, then select Data usage.
Turning on data roaming may incur excessive charges depending on the policies of the local network provider. Continue?
Connecting to mobile data networks allowed. Your device will be able to access data services, such as GPS data transmission or synchronization, without your authorization.

Using data roaming may result in additional charges in addition to your domestic flat rate plan. Using automatic updates for email or applications may also result in additional charges. Using large-data services such as video or email may result in charges over 20,000 won per minute.
Connecting to mobile networks may result in additional charges if you are not using a flat rate plan. Connect?
To use data roaming, go to Settings > Global roaming, then turn on data roaming.
Connecting to mobile networks may result in additional charges if you are not using a flat rate plan. Connect?

Tap to turn off Use LTE when available.
"Access to mobile network blocked by service provider. Contact customer service (1544-0010)."

A network service that diverts incoming calls to a specified number when you are unable to answer calls; for example, when you are on the device or your device is off. You first need to subscribe to the service. Contact customer center (114+Send) to subscribe or unsubscribe to this service. Enter *72+(a number)+Send to turn on call forwarding, or *720+Send to turn off.

A network service that diverts all incoming calls and text messages to a specified number. You have to subscribe to this service. You will be charged a monthly fee. Contact the customer center (114+Send) to subscribe or unsubscribe to this service; enter *71+(number to forward calls to)+Send to turn on, or *710+Send to turn off.
A free network service that allows you to answer a second call during a call, placing the first call on hold. Enter *40+Send to turn on, or *400+Send to turn off.
Unregistered subscriber. Check your registration status and try again.

Set up easy international call dialing while roaming.

Assisted dialing allows you to make international calls easily while roaming in another country. First, set the country setting to your home location. You may also edit the International call prefix, the International direct dialing (IDD) prefixes, the National direct dialing (NDD) prefixes, City/area codes, and the national number length.
Reduce the probability of being interrupted during calls.

"1. To call China from abroad, select either Dial number in China or **133 Dial number in China, then tap Call.
2. To call another country from abroad, select Dial other international number. Then select the target country and tap Call.
3. To call a local number, select Dial local number and tap Call."
